DOC.brief_title: The Effectiveness of Probiotics for the Therapy of Acute Pharyngotonsillitis in Adult Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Hypothesis The addition of probiotics to the routine therapy of AP in adult patients may shorten the duration, and reduce the severity of the disease. Study design A prospective, randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blinded study comparing treatment with probiotics to placebo in patients with AP. The study will be conducted in accordance with the ethical standards of the Helsinki Declaration and will be approved by the Human Experimentation Ethics Committee of the Ziv Medical Center. Signed informed consent will be required from all patients before inclusion.
DOC.criteria: Age over 18 years Acute pharyngotonsillitis for which hospitalization for intravenous antibiotic treatment and/or fluids is needed Current therapy with systemic prednisone or equivalent at 20 mg/d for more than 10 days prior to inclusion
